citation.article-title: Jhaorihella thermophila gen. nov., sp. nov., a moderately thermophilic bacterium isolated from a coastal hot spring
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Jhaorihella thermophila sp. nov.
Jhaorihella thermophila (ther.mo′phi.la. Gr. adj. thermos hot; Gr. adj. philos loving; N.L. fem. adj. thermophila heat-loving).
In addition to the characteristics reported above in the genus description, cells are 1.0~1.2 µm in width and 2.0~5.0 µm in length.
Some cells are irregularly rod-shaped.
Growth is visible after incubation for 24 h on MA at 37 °C.
Colonies on MA are beige-coloured and circular with a spreading edge.
Growth does not occur on tryptic soy, nutrient or yeast extract agars.
Growth occurs at 25–55 °C (optimum, 37–45 °C), but not at 20 °C or 60 °C.
Growth occurs at pH 5.0–9.0 (optimum, pH 8.0) and in the presence of 2–6 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum, 3–4 %).
Obligate requirement for natural seawater or artificial sea salts.
No anaerobic growth occurs on MA supplemented with potassium nitrate.
Oxidase- and catalase–positive.
Accumulates poly-β-hydroxybutyric acid granules as polar inclusion bodies.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
Flexirubin type pigments are not produced and acid is not produced from d-glucose, d-xylose, l-arabinose, d-galactose, d-sorbitol, myo-inositol, d-ribose, d-mannitol or l-rhamnose.

The following carbon sources are utilized in the Biolog GN-II system: d-mannitol, d-mannose, melibiose, pyruvic acid methyl ester, succinic acid monomethyl ester, formic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, γ-ketoglutaric acid, dl-lactic acid, succinamic acid, d-alanine, l-alanine, l-proline, γ-aminobutyric acid and 2,3-butanediol.
No other carbon sources in the GN-II system are utilized.
Positive reactions (API 20E and 20NE) are seen in tests for citrate utilization, acetoin and cytochrome oxidase.
Additional physiological features are given in Table 1.
The fatty acid profile of strain CC-MHSW-1T is given in Table 2.
The type strain, CC-MHSW-1T ( = JCM 15068T = CCM 7767T), was isolated from a coastal hot spring, Taiwan.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 64.7 mol%.
